task.title: Change single-line text
task.shortdesc: You have two methods to modify single-line text:

ul.li: To modify only the content of the text, use DDEDIT command.

To change text style, location, size and content, use PROPERTIES command to open Properties palette, fromwhich, you can make the relevant settings.
To edit text
Type DDEDIT and then press Enter.
Select the single line text.
In the Edit Text box, edit the text and then press Enter.

step.cmd: Select a single line text object.
Right-click the selected object andthen click Properties on the shortcut menu.
In the Properties palette, enter any new text in the Text Contents, andthen change formatting and other properties as needed.

result.p: You can also move, scale or rotate text through grips as like other objects. The grip of a single-line text is displayed at the lower-left corner of the baseline and the alignment point. As shown in the following picture:
